title: A Tale of Two Cities
content: Set during the French Revolution, this novel contrasts the lives of two men who look alike but have very different fates.

title: All Quiet on the Western Front
content: A harrowing account of a German soldier's experiences and disillusionment during World War I.

title: Pride and Prejudice
content: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
War is peace.Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength. These paradoxes define the dystopian society in which the characters find themselves trapped.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
content: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view, until you climb into his skin and walk around in it.

title: The Great Gatsby
content: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past. This line captures the essence of Gatsby's tragic pursuit.

title: Brave New World
content: Words can be like X-rays if you use them properly—they’ll go through anything. You read and you’re pierced by their meaning.

title: Jane Eyre
content: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will, which I now exert to leave you.
